de.esoco.lib.comm

Class Endpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<org.obrel.core.Relatable,Connection>
        • de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<Endpoint>, java.util.function.Function<org.obrel.core.Relatable,Connection>, org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<Endpoint>, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpEndpoint, JsonRpcEndpoint, PipeEndpoint, SocketEndpoint

    public abstract class Endpoint
extends de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<org.obrel.core.Relatable,Connection>
implements org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<Endpoint>
    Describes an endpoint of a connection in the communication framework. New endpoint types must be registered for the URI schemes they can handle by invoking registerEndpointType(Class, String, String...). All implementations must provide a no-arguments constructor which it is used by the factory method at(String) to create new endpoint instances.

    Some endpoint implementations may need access to global configuration values. These can be injected by invoking the static method setGlobalConfiguration(ProvidesConfiguration). The provided Relatable instance must then contain relations with the respective configuration values.

      Enumeration of the user info fields in a URI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Endpoint

        public Endpoint()
        The standard constructor. All subclasses must provide a no-arguments constructor because it is used by the factory method at(String) to create new endpoint instances.

    • Method Detail

      • at

        public static Endpoint at(java.lang.String sEndpointUri)
        Returns an endpoint instance for a certain URI. The endpoint will be initialized from the URI data. Authentication data will be moved from the endpoint address URI to the CommunicationRelationTypes.USER_NAME and CommunicationRelationTypes.PASSWORD relations.
        Parameters:
        sEndpointUri - The URI to create the endpoint for
        Returns:
        The endpoint for the given URI

      • getDefaultParams

        public static final org.obrel.core.Relatable getDefaultParams()
        Returns the default parameters for all endpoints. These parameters will only be used if they are not overridden by any endpoint-specific parameters.
        Returns:
        A relatable containing the default parameters for all endpoint instances

      • getGlobalConfiguration

        public static org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration getGlobalConfiguration()
        Returns the global endpoint configuration which is a Relatable object containing the configuration relations. An application-specific configuration can been set with setGlobalConfiguration(ProvidesConfiguration).
        Returns:
        The global endpoint configuration

      • registerEndpointType

        public static void registerEndpointType(java.lang.Class<? extends Endpoint> rEndpointClass,
                                        java.lang.String sPrimaryScheme,
                                        java.lang.String... sAdditionalSchemes)
        Registers a new endpoint type for one or more URI schemes. Additional schemes typically are SSL/TLS-encrypted variants of the base scheme or vice versa.
        Parameters:
        rEndpointClass - The endpoint type to register
        sPrimaryScheme - The primary URI scheme to associate the type with
        sAdditionalSchemes - Optional additional URI schemes

      • setDefaultParams

        public static final void setDefaultParams(org.obrel.core.Relatable rDefaultParams)
        Sets (and replaces) the default parameters for all endpoints. These parameters will only be used if they are not overridden by any endpoint-specific parameters.
        Parameters:
        rDefaultParams - A relatable containing the default parameters for all endpoint instances (must not be NULL)

      • setGlobalConfiguration

        public static void setGlobalConfiguration(org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration rConfiguration)
        Sets the global endpoint configuration. The configuration is an arbitrary Relatable object that must contain the relations with the configuration values for the endpoints needed by an application. NULL values will cause an exception. To clear the configuration an empty relatable should be set.
        Parameters:
        rConfiguration - The global configuration object (must not be NULL)

      • getConfigValue

        protected static <T> T getConfigValue(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rConfigType,
                                      T rDefaultValue)
        Returns a configuration value from the global endpoint configuration.
        Parameters:
        rConfigType - The configuration relation type
        rDefaultValue - The default value to return if no configuration value is available
        Returns:
        The configuration value or the default if no config available

      • connect

        public Connection connect()
        A no-argument connect method that invokes connect(Relatable) with a NULL parameter.
        Returns:
        A connection initialized for this endpoint

      • connect

        public Connection connect(org.obrel.core.Relatable rParams)
        Returns a connection that is initialized for communication with this endpoint. It is also the implementation of and a synonym for the standard Function method evaluate(Relatable).
        Parameters:
        rParams - Optional connection parameters or NULL for none
        Returns:
        The new connection

      • closeConnection

        protected abstract void closeConnection(Connection rConnection)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes any resources that have been acquired on initializing the given connection. Any exception thrown by this method will be converted into a CommunicationException.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection to close
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • initConnection

        protected abstract void initConnection(Connection rConnection)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented to initialize any resources that are needed to use the given connection. Any exception thrown by this method will be converted into a CommunicationException.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection to initialize
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • init

        protected void init()
        Can be implemented by subclasses to perform additional initialization from the connection URI and/or the global configuration.
